issues.description: The problem statement uses an inconsistent method name for the total-students accessor: line 40 uses snake_case `get_total_number_of_students()` while the UML, task references, template TODOs, and the solution use camelCase `getTotalNumberOfStudents()`. This naming inconsistency in the problem description may confuse students about the exact method name/signature they should implement and how tests will call it.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the problem statement to consistently use the camelCase method name `getTotalNumberOfStudents()` (matching the UML, template TODO, and solution). Update the line that currently reads `get_total_number_of_students()` to `getTotalNumberOfStudents()` so students are not confused about the expected method signature.

issues.description: The problem statement text uses the snake_case identifier `get_total_number_of_students()` (line 40), while the UML diagram and the code use the camelCase method name `getTotalNumberOfStudents()`. This minor naming mismatch between the human-readable task description and the actual method name in the template/solution can create brief mapping confusion for students when they look for the method to implement or test.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the identifier naming across artifacts. Update the problem statement to use the camelCase form `getTotalNumberOfStudents()` (matching the UML and code) or explicitly note that `get_total_number_of_students()` refers to the same method. Prefer camelCase in the problem text to match Java naming conventions and the provided code.
